timeline.message: Extract common logic of visualizeBlockNode() into a helper method.

timeline.bodyText: The two escape methods can stay private, right?
timeline.author: wmdietl

timeline.bodyText: How about Format the given object as a String suitable for the output format, i.e. with format-specific characters escaped.
timeline.author: wmdietl

timeline.message: Pull the latest code. Resolve comments.

timeline.bodyText: Now that the two visualizeBlockNode methods are exactly the same, should we just remove them and make the Helper the real implementation in AbstractCFGVisualizer?
timeline.author: wmdietl

timeline.bodyText:
What happens if analysis is null? Before, it looks like an escapeString is appended when it is a SPECIAL_BLOCK.
Is that missing now? Is that a problem or intended?
timeline.author: wmdietl

replies.bodyText:
It is intended, this logic is no longer needed.
visualizeSpecialBlockHelper should be responsible for making special blocks centered. DOTCFGVisualizer now passes a separator to visualizeSpecialBlockHelper: https://github.com/typetools/checker-framework/pull/3395/files#diff-f708a265ff3b24e68538c35aef4dfb7eR136
Now in this situation, when the analysis is null, a special block in DOT will be like: [shape=oval label="<entry>\n"] (already centered).
replies.author: xingweitian

timeline.author: wmdietl

timeline.bodyText: Would it be hard to track down where the trailing spaces are coming from and make the output proper by construction?
timeline.author: wmdietl

replies.bodyText: I just came up with another way to avoid trailing spaces. Thanks for the remind!
replies.author: xingweitian

timeline.bodyText:
Can you add a comment why the lineSeparator is only needed in this case?
Wasn't it nicer before with the Helper method that reduced duplication?
timeline.author: wmdietl

replies.bodyText: I have pushed a better solution... The previous change has been reverted.
replies.author: xingweitian
